It is a true honor to represent the Tenth Congressional District, and I am humbled by the trust the voters placed in me as a voice for our communities in Washington. My offices are here to serve you, so don’t hesitate to get in touch for help with a federal agency, information on legislation, or just to share an opinion or a good story. I look forward to getting to work for you.
Twenty million people now have insurance thanks to the ACA. We need to strengthen and improve the law, not rip coverage away from those that need it most. We can't go backwards.

The 58th Presidential Inauguration is Friday, January 20, 2017, on the West Front of the U.S. Capitol in Washington, DC.   If you are interested in attending, our office has received a limited number of tickets, which will be distributed via lottery to constituents.   Please complete the below form before 5:00pm CT on Tuesday, January 10. Those selected by lottery for tickets will be notified shortly after with instructions on ways to pick up tickets prior to the inauguration.  Please call our office with any questions at 202-225-4835. It is an honor to serve you.

This afternoon, I shared the story of Javon Wilson on the House floor. Javon was the grandson of my friend Congressman Danny K. Davis, and was just 15 when he was shot and killed in Chicago. In this new Congress, together we have the opportunity to save lives and make our communities safer by reducing the epidemic of gun violence. This is a priority for me and my constituents and I look forward to working with my colleagues, on both sides of the aisle, to finally make progress.

I strongly condemn today's horrific terrorist attack in Jerusalem and pray for the victims, the injured, and their families. The United States stands in solidarity with Israel, and with all countries, against cowardly and senseless acts of terrorism.
Our office has a limited number of tickets available for the Presidential Inauguration on Friday, January 20. If interested, please submit the below form before 5:00pm CT today:

Honored to again join the House Foreign Affairs Committee. My focus will be keeping Americans safe, while working to support our allies and maintain the United States as a force for good in global affairs.

I introduced the HALOS Act during my first term in Congress and was pleased to see it pass the House with overwhelming bipartisan support yesterday. This is a commonsense bill that removes a burden hindering entrepreneurs and inventors from meeting with investors, clearing the way for startup companies to find the capital they need to grow and ultimately create jobs.

President-elect Trump says he wants to grow manufacturing jobs, but instead of an actual plan, the American people are stuck trying to decipher his late night tweets like tea leaves.   Today, I signed on to legislation introduced by my friend Rep. Bustos to demand a plan and accountability from the President-elect on outsourcing and manufacturing.

Anyone serious about improving our health care system should count me as a willing partner, but that is not what we’ve heard from President-elect Trump and my Republican colleagues.   Their plan to repeal Obamacare without a replacement is absolutely irresponsible and will end up hurting millions.

Rep. John Lewis is my personal hero.   Today I was fortunate to hear him address our bipartisan group in honor of Martin Luther King Jr. Day about his lifetime of experience fighting for civil rights.

Our country is a better, more equal place today because of Rep. John Lewis's bravery and moral leadership.  Donald Trump would be better served spending this Martin Luther King Jr. weekend reflecting on Lewis's example than tweeting.

This weekend, we remember Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and honor his Dream of a more just and equal nation.  Dr. King challenged us to see that “injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.” May these words continue to guide us as we strive to end discrimination, protect equal rights for all, and ensure opportunity for each of our fellow citizens.  Inspired by the examples of Dr. King and other heroes of the Civil Rights Movement, people across the country will be participating tomorrow in a National Day of Service. I invite you to join us. You can learn more about opportunities to serve in your local community below:

Honored to join the annual Waukegan Township Martin Luther King Jr. Dreamers’ Breakfast this morning to reflect on Dr. King’s legacy and celebrate those who continue to live by his example by promoting justice and equality.

Glad I could join in Day of Service events at the Northbrook and Grayslake public libraries today. Read to children about Dr. King and was able to leave a donation of surplus books from the Library of Congress. #MLKDayofService

Repealing the Affordable Care Act without a replacement is dangerously irresponsible. The non-partisan CBO says repealing the ACA would leave 18 million Americans uninsured and increase premiums by 20 percent in just the first year.
The numbers are clear: the GOP plan to repeal #ACA would cause health insurance premiums to skyrocket. https://www.cbo.gov/publication/52371

We need your help. Rather than working to improve our healthcare system, Republicans want to repeal the Affordable Care Act with no replacement, hurting families across the Tenth District. Your stories can make a difference. If the ACA has helped you or if you’re concerned about repeal, please use the below form to share your experiences with my office.
Rep. Jan Schakowsky and I had a great meeting today on defending choice and protecting the Affordable Care Act with some visiting constituents in DC for the Women’s March. Thanks for stopping by!

Dropped by for coffee this morning with the Navy's Office of Legislative Affairs. Looking forward to working with their team to support Naval Station Great Lakes and the military families of the Tenth District.

Forty-four years ago this week, the Supreme Court decided Roe v. Wade. Yet President Trump and the Republican Congress have made restricting choice their first order of business. I spoke on the floor to urge my colleagues to end this backward attack on women’s rights and start tackling the real challenges voters sent us here to address.
This Holocaust Memorial Day, we honor the memories of those lost and recommit ourselves to the fight against prejudice and hate. Never again.
BINGO! Thanks Northbrook Park District for inviting me to call the game, and more importantly hear from our seniors about their concerns and priorities.

President Trump's executive order targeting refugees is a disgraceful and callous attempt to ban members of one religion by instituting a de facto religious test for entry. This discriminatory order does nothing to address the root causes of terrorism, does not make our country safer, and undermines the very values that define our nation.  We are a nation founded by immigrants and refugees who were fleeing oppression and often fearful for their lives. We cannot allow fear to overwhelm our ideals and close the door on the next generation of Americans seeking refuge from war, violence, and oppression.

So proud of the Tenth District residents at Am Shalom for sponsoring and warmly welcoming one of the last families of Syrian refugees to arrive before the Trump Administration slammed the door shut last night.  Take note President Trump: your discriminatory ban does not represent our values.

I joined the thousands at Chicago O’Hare and at airports around the country tonight sending the loud message that President Trump’s new executive order targeting refugees does not represent who we are as a nation.
These remarkable men and women deserve our gratitude for their service. Glad I could join the Lake County Navy League dinner last night in their honor.

Thanking our veterans for their service this Valentine’s Day is a great way to give back to those who have given so much for our country. Learn more here --> https://schneider.house.gov/media/press-releases/schneider-launches-valentines-vets-program

On the wall behind me, my great-grandparents and family who fled the pogroms against Jews in Russia. In my hand, a photo of my sons. We cannot allow fear to overwhelm our ideals and close the door on the next generation of Americans seeking refuge from war, violence, and oppression.  #RefugeesWelcome

Proud to sign on to this legislation, which would deny funds to enforce President Trump’s executive order on refugees, and ensure that our government cannot reject people for entry based solely on their religion or nationality.

Rather than making our nation safer, the President's executive order discredits our heritage and undermines our shared values. Today, I shared an example of those values from the Tenth District on the House floor:

Today, President Trump nominated Neil Gorsuch for the Supreme Court for a position that should not still be vacant and in an appointment that should not be this President’s to make.  For nearly a year, Senate Republicans cynically abdicated their duty by refusing to even grant a hearing to President Obama’s supremely qualified nominee, Merrick Garland.  Over the course of a lifetime appointment, the next Justice will cast votes that affect equality for the LGBT community, a woman’s right to choose, the right of all our citizens to vote, commonsense legislation to prevent gun violence, and more.  We cannot afford a Supreme Court justice with views out of step with the American people. I know my Democratic colleagues in the Senate will vigorously examine Gorsuch’s views and qualifications for this position. Our nation will be counting on their judgment.
Thank you Illinois Association of School Boards members for meeting in my office yesterday. I look forward to continuing to work with you to  advocate for our students and local schools.

Black history is American history. In February, we celebrate the lasting contributions African-Americans have made to our democracy, society, and culture. We remember and learn from the prejudices overcome, and we resolve to address the inequalities of today by continuing to fight for justice. #BlackHistoryMonth

I oppose this effort to weaken our background check system at a time when too many communities across the country are suffering from gun violence. Congress needs to be supporting smart gun safety policies, not undermining the system we have in place.

I spoke on the floor about bipartisan legislation I introduced this week to allow veterans to use their GI Bill dollars for internship programs. This bill brings together veterans and manufacturers to bridge the skills gap and expand the job opportunities available to those who served.

These are the consequences of President Trump's reckless executive order restricting refugees and other immigrants. If you or  your family is affected, please contact our Lincolnshire office at 847-383-4870. We have caseworkers who may be able to help.
Great discussion at Illinois Education Association event on closing the achievement gap. All our children should have access to a quality education, regardless of their zip code.
Discussed the Trump Administration's efforts to weaken environmental protections, and ways to continue to make progress combatting climate change with Sierra Club Illinois yesterday.
At a meeting of the Bipartisan Heroin Task Force today to hear from experts about the most effective strategies to reverse the opioid epidemic.
More evidence that the time to address global climate change is now.

Real people will be hurt by the irresponsible plan to repeal the Affordable Care Act. Today, I shared the story of a constituent who wrote to our office how the ACA was there “when the bottom dropped out” for her family after a job loss.
Great first telephone town hall this evening answering questions and updating constituents on my work in Congress. Thank you to more than 2,500 Tenth District residents who participated.

I’m honored and excited to join the work of the Judiciary Committee this Congress. This appointment is a platform for the people of the Tenth District on the important issues we face from immigration to gun safety to voting rights and more.

The American people deserve an Attorney General who will protect and advance civil rights, LGBT equality, and voting rights. Throughout his career, Sessions has demonstrated the reverse - a fierce opposition to the very laws he will be responsible for defending and upholding as our nation’s top law enforcement officer.   I am committed to protecting our progress toward equality, and intend to closely monitor the actions of the Department of Justice with my colleagues on the House Judiciary Committee.

Thanks to the students at Hawthorn Middle School South for making hundreds of cards for Valentines for Vets! I am looking forward to distributing them and thanking #IL10 veterans for their service. There’s still time to participate. Learn more: https://schneider.house.gov/media/press-releases/schneider-launches-valentines-vets-program

Check out these student artists from Kildeer Countryside Community Consolidated School District 96 making cards for our veterans this Valentine’s Day. Thank you to everyone who dropped off cards at our Lincolnshire office for us to distribute.

Last week I joined a bipartisan group of colleagues calling for sanctions on El Aissami due to his ties to the terrorist group, Hezbollah. These new sanctions are an appropriate response to the Venezuelan leadership’s unacceptable support of international drug trafficking and human rights abuses.

National Security Advisor Michael Flynn’s resignation does not resolve the serious and urgent questions surrounding the Trump Administration’s contact with Russia and that country’s unprecedented interference in on our election. This is not a matter of partisan politics, and the American people deserve answers. I once again call for an independent, bipartisan investigation to get the facts.
What more will it take for Speaker Ryan to allow an independent, bipartisan investigation? We need answers.
Honored to accept @USArmy seal today for display in our office. Look forward to working with you to support our men and women in uniform.

I am, and always will be absolutely committed to the security of the Jewish state of Israel and a peaceful resolution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, and I will continue to advocate for a two-state solution as the best way forward.”

Today the House launched another shameful assault on women’s health, voting to make it easier for states to deny Title X family planning funds to qualified medical providers for purely ideological reasons. These are not the priorities the American people sent us to Washington to address.

Through nearly four decades in the House of Representatives, former U.S. Minority Leader Bob Michel never allowed partisan rancor to get in the way of serving Illinois. His decency and commitment to working across the aisle for the good of the American people are examples to those of us who hold elected office today. I am grateful for his years of service to the nation in our armed forces and in public office, and I offer my sincere condolences to his family and friends at this difficult time.

This afternoon I had the opportunity to meet with local DREAMers in Waukegan to hear their experiences growing up undocumented. Many came to the United States so young, they know no other country but here. They are as American as you or me. It it shameful to force these young people to live lives in the shadows under constant fear of deportation, which is why I strongly support continuing DACA and will stand against any attempts by the Trump Administration to rollback these protections.  Thank you HACES for your work in our communities and for hosting today's roundtable. Below is a photo with the HACES staff.
Thank you to the residents of Lake Forest Place for the welcome this afternoon. I enjoyed our conversation!

These harsh new rules threaten to tear apart families, and demand scrutiny from Congress. They will harm our communities and economy, while doing nothing to address the real issues of our broken immigration system. I urge my colleagues on the House Judiciary Committee to hold hearings on the full effect of these draconian orders.

The new Homeland Security guidelines are the next step in the Trump Administration’s harmful anti-immigrant agenda. Many in our communities are afraid about what these regulations mean for their families and friends, and we need answers. Here’s my letter urging the House Judiciary Committee to investigate.

Young people who grew up here should not have to live under fear of deportation. Here’s a clip of me talking about my recent meeting with DREAMers in Waukegan on Politics Tonight. Watch our full interview here: http://bit.ly/2mgpfSs

Nearly 1 in 4 residents of the Tenth District are immigrants. These new Americans pay taxes, own homes, and start businesses. We’re glad you’re here contributing to our communities. #ImmigrantsWelcome

I invited Illinois resident Tracy Trovato as my guest to President Trump’s address tomorrow night. A few years ago, after Tracy’s husband Carlo contracted a rare and aggressive form of leukemia, she discovered their family's insurance policy contained a cap on lifetime benefits that may not have been enough to cover his treatment. However, thanks to the Affordable Care Act, lifetime caps are prohibited and Carlo was able to get the care he needed.   President Trump’s repeal plan will hurt families like Tracy’s, as well as millions of others who have gained health insurance through the ACA. Instead of repeal, let's work together to improve health care for all Americans.

At tonight’s speech, President Trump has an opportunity to offer more than simple denunciations of this dramatic and dangerous increase in anti-Semitic activity. I urge the President to not only condemn these attacks in the strongest possible terms, but to more importantly offer a concrete plan of action to ensure the security of Jewish institutions and stem the rising tide of hate throughout our country.

Proud to join with my colleagues on the House Judiciary Committee this morning seeking answers from the Department of Justice into President Trump’s personal and campaign associates' connections with Russia. The American people deserve to know the facts. #ResolutionofInquiry #HRes111

I'm proud to bring Tracy Trovato as my guest to President Trump's speech tonight. After Tracy's husband Carlo contracted a rare form of leukemia, reforms in the Affordable Care Act removing lifetime caps ensured he could get the care he needed without bankrupting their family. Read more about their story here: http://bit.ly/2maugv4

Testifying before the Appropriations Subcommittee today about prioritizing funding for US Citizenship and Immigration Services, which processes applications from refugees. We must ensure we can accurately and quickly vet the next generation of Americans fleeing violence and oppression to seek a better life in the United States.

Great to see #IL10’s Chelsea Laliberte today and participate in yesterday’s Addiction Policy Forum. The work that Live4Lali does to address substance use disorders and overdoses is inspiring. I look forward to working with them to ensure our communities have the resources they need to counter the opioid epidemic.

Today, I led my Illinois colleagues to urge Governor Rauner to continue to protect transgender students in our state. President Trump's recent decision to rescind the Obama Administration guidance takes us backward and threatens our LGBT youth. We must be vigilant to ensure this change does not result in the adoption of discriminatory policies in Illinois schools.

From the start, Attorney General Sessions should have recused himself from any investigation into connections between the Trump campaign and Russia, but he refused. New revelations that Sessions misled the Senate under oath about two meetings with the Russian Ambassador during the campaign erase what little credibility remained. These allegations, if accurate, are disqualifying, and should compel Attorney General Sessions to resign.

Thanks for all the questions on our telephone town hall this evening. If you want to make sure you're on the list for future telephone town halls, please call my office and we'll add your number - (202) 225-4835.

A gun bought online as a kit that needs to be assembled is just as deadly as any other firearm, but current law doesn’t require a background check. That’s dangerous and makes no sense. I’m proud to help introduce legislation to close this egregious loophole and make our communities safer.

President Trump’s proposed 97 percent cut to the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative is shockingly irresponsible. This would virtually eliminate the program working to clean up our Great Lakes, control invasive species, restore habitats and reduce run-off. I will fight to preserve this funding and our environment for future generations.

Fifty-two years ago this week, Congressman John Lewis and other marchers were brutally attacked on the Edmund Pettus Bridge as they marched for civil rights for African-Americans. This weekend, I was honored to join Rep. Lewis and other members of Congress on a pilgrimage to Montgomery, Birmingham and Selma to reflect on the lessons of the civil rights movement. We must continue to work with renewed purpose to end racial discrimination, protect voting rights, and ensure opportunity for all of our children.

Regardless the window dressing, today’s revised executive order still does not make our country safer, does nothing to target the root causes of terrorism, and undermines the values that define our nation.  I support continuing to improve our screening processes for refugees and others admitted into the United States, but arbitrarily banning entry from certain Muslim-majority countries and barring refugees fleeing terror remains wrong and ineffective.

It’s AmeriCorps Week 2017, a time to celebrate the more than 80,000 Americans currently serving their communities through this program.   Illinois’s Tenth District is the proud home of a number of AmeriCorps volunteers, including Ismael Calderón, who is working to ensure all of our children enter kindergarten ready to learn by coordinating an early childhood education program with United Way of Lake County in North Chicago. AmeriCorps and other national service organizations would be cut under President Trump’s budget. We must ensure volunteers like Ismael have the resources to continue their great work in our communities.

The Republican health care bill released last night is a giant step backwards, raising out-of-pocket costs for those who can least afford it while pushing people off insurance and removing protections. I’m ready to work with anyone to improve the Affordable Care Act and fix what could work better, but we can’t take our country back through a reckless repeal plan.

I have serious concerns about David Friedman’s experience and perspective to serve as the US ambassador to Israel. In particular, his past rejection of the two-state solution stands in stark opposition to US foreign policy and threatens to undermine our diplomatic efforts in the region. Our next ambassador must work to continue the crucial bipartisan support for our ally Israel, responsibly work towards a two-state solution in which Israelis and Palestinians can live side-by-side in peace and security, and build on the unity between people of the United States and Israel, irrespective of religious beliefs or party lines.
Forcing Americans to #PayMoreForLess coverage moves our health care in the wrong direction.

No American should face discrimination finding a home because of who they are or who they love. But currently only 22 states prohibit house discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity. I’m very proud to join Congressman Scott Taylor to introduce bipartisan legislation to extend federal housing protections to all LGBTQ individuals and same-sex couples.
Great hearing from and answering questions for constituents at our "Congress on Your Corner"  at Deerfield High School. Thanks for coming out!

Have an issue with Medicare, Social Security, the Veterans Administration, immigration or more? Our team will be at Des Plaines Public Library tomorrow and ready to help.  If you can't make it, we’re always available at our Lincolnshire Office. Call us at 847-383-4870.

By nearly every measure, the American Health Care Act is a disappointing step backward for our country’s health care system. The non-partisan Congressional Budget Office estimates that next year, 14 million more people will be uninsured if this law is passed, and that number will continue to increase to 24 million by 2026. At the same time, individuals buying insurance could expect to pay 15 to 20 percent more than under current law.    The Affordable Care Act isn't perfect, and members on both sides of the aisle who are serious about improving the law while protecting the advancements made should count me as a partner. But more money for less coverage is not progress. I strongly urge my colleagues to vote against this bill.

Preserving the memory of the six million Jews and so many others lost in the Holocaust, and advancing understanding of the Holocaust and its historical context are vitally important tasks, perhaps never more important than at this historic moment. I am honored to be selected to join the United States Holocaust Memorial Council to support the Museum’s critical work ensuring we never forget, seeking to always prevent the horrors of genocide, and always recognizing the inherent dignity of all people.
Tax Day is just a month away. Not to worry, there are trained professionals who may be able to help you file your taxes for free at 16 sites throughout the district. Learn more here:

As a proud Navy Dad, I was honored to accept the U.S. Navy seal today to display in our office I look forward to working together to support Naval Station Great Lakes and our men and women in uniform.

President Trump has proposed virtually eliminating the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative with a 97 percent budget cut – a disaster for the environment and local economy. Today I spoke on the House Floor in defense of the program's vital work.

YouthBuild Lake County is a huge asset for our communities, working with young people to provide education opportunities and job training skills. It was great to meet with some of the local #IL10 participants and hear their experiences with the organization.

WATCH LIVE: My GOP colleagues are continuing to push forward with their health care repeal bill without a single official hearing to discuss the impact of the legislation on the American people or our economy. Today I joined House Democrats to question a panel of experts on the consequences of the #PayMoreForLess bill.

The death of a child is a loss like no other, yet current law leaves no time for employees to grieve and begin the recovery process. Today I was proud to join with Rep. Paul Gosar and others to introduce bipartisan legislation to amend the Family and Medical Leave Act to permit employees to take the unpaid time off they need to care for their families and heal following such a tragic loss.
Showing some alumni pride and cheering on Northwestern Men's Basketball from DC today! #b1gcats #ncaabasketball
Our next "Congress on Your Corner" is this Saturday at North Chicago Community High School. Hope to see you there!

Yesterday, I wrote the Federal Railroad Administration to urge their investigation into this week's derailment in Lake Forest be thorough, transparent and timely. Neighboring communities and policymakers need to better understand what caused the derailment and what steps can be taken to prevent future accidents.

Kicking off the SeaPerch Competition at Naval Station Great Lakes this morning to build underwater remote-operated vehicles. Great to see young people learning learning STEM skills and having fun at the same time.

In Buffalo Grove, discussing my serious concerns with the congressional Republican's heath care plan which would raise costs and leave 24 million more Americans without insurance. We need to build on the progress of the Affordable Care Act and fix what isn't working, not move backwards through repeal.

Director Comey just confirmed the FBI is examining possible links between Russia and associates of President Trump in connection to an investigation into Russia’s interference in our election. The American people deserve answers. I continue to support an independent, bipartisan commission to follow the facts.
The repeal and replace plan would add fuel to the fire of the opioid epidemic by no longer requiring Medicaid to cover mental health and addiction services.
In the Tenth District, the reckless repeal and replace health care plan would leave 37,800 more residents uninsured over next decade.

On this seventh anniversary of the Affordable Care Act, I stood with my colleagues and VP Biden to protect the progress we’ve made. We need to be improving the law, not taking our country backward through a reckless repeal that will leave 24 million more Americans without insurance and increase costs for working families and seniors.

Proud to welcome local entrepreneur David Borris, who owns a Northbrook catering company, to the House Small Business Committee today. David testified about the quality health care he can offer employees through the Affordable Care Act, crediting the law with stabilizing rising premium costs for his company.

Critical provisions like requiring pre-existing condition coverage, no lifetime insurance caps, and essential health benefits are not bargaining chips. Real people’s health care is at stake. GOP leaders are making their bill even more extreme and throwing commonsense policies overboard in a rushed effort to meet an arbitrary deadline.
I’ll be at College of Lake County in Grayslake on Saturday for our next Congress On Your Corner event. Hope you can join us!

Our office phones have been ringing off the hook this week and I’m pitching in too. Just spoke with Elise, a senior in Gurnee opposed to the AHCA. I hear your concerns and you can count on me to vote against this disastrous #PayMoreForLess bill.
Here’s why I’m voting NO on the congressional Republican’s #PayMoreForLess health care bill.

To everyone who called, emailed, and wrote our office over the last week: Thank you, your voices were heard.    There's certainly a lot to discuss. Come join me in person this Saturday in Grayslake at our next Congress On Your Corner.
Proud to support the great work of Meals on Wheels America and Catholic Charities of the Archdiocese of Chicago throughout Lake County last night at the 18th Annual Banquet in Fox Lake.

Read the Lake County News-Sun’s recap of this Saturday's Congress On Your Corner in Grayslake.  “With the current bill's failure, he said he hopes Republicans and Democrats can now work together to ‘start to tackle the problems,’ such as making sure residents have more than one insurance option and that insurance companies can contract with health networks and providers close to where customers live.”

Just three weeks left to file your taxes before April 18. Check out the following locations throughout the Tenth District where you may qualify for free basic income tax return prep and filing from IRS-certified volunteers.

Addressing climate change is one of the most important long-term challenges for our future, and represents a pressing national security threat. The executive order from President Trump undercutting the Clean Power Plan, weakening restrictions on emissions, and expanding federal coal mining leases reverses recent progress and will worsen this crisis.

Appreciate former Secretary of State Madeleine K. Albright sharing her wisdom on our foreign affairs challenges this morning and the importance of maintaining robust investment in diplomacy and international affairs. With National Democratic Institute - NDI and U.S. Global Leadership Coalition (USGLC).
Today I spoke on the House floor about introducing the CLIMATE Act. We can’t backslide when it comes to protecting our planet.

Russia’s interference in our election violated the core of our democracy, and there is no room for partisanship in our investigation of this breach. Unfortunately, the actions of Chairman Nunes cast serious doubts about his impartiality and undermine a fair and thorough investigation.   Congress must vote to create an independent commission so America can #FollowtheFacts.
Great to join KA VOICE (Korean American Voter Organizing Initiative & Community Empowerment) to discuss the importance of standing against anti-immigrant rhetoric and policies.

Last week, I introduced the CLIMATE Act to block President Trump’s anti-environment executive order. Read my most recent email newsletter to stay updated on my work for you and invited to events in the district.

Don’t forget to exercise your right to vote! Tomorrow, Tuesday April 4 is election day for local offices in communities throughout the Tenth District. Find out where to vote:  Lake County - https://www.lakecountyil.gov/351/Voter-Power Cook County - http://www.cookcountyclerk.com/elections/Pages/default.aspx

On average, women in Illinois earn just 79 cents for every dollar a man makes. It's unacceptable that it is 2017 and women are still fighting for equal pay for equal work. I'm proud to co-sponsor the Paycheck Fairness Act to help close the gender pay gap. #EqualPayDay

On any night in America, nearly 40,000 veterans are without a home. It’s unconscionable that men and women who served our country, and may still bear the physical and mental scars of that service, are forced to live on the streets.   I’m proud to introduce today bipartisan legislation that would give Americans the option to divert a portion of their tax refund to aid homeless veterans via a check off box on the annual tax return. This is a small, commonsense step to make it easier to give back to those who sacrificed for us.
Congrats to the winners and newly-elected officials of yesterday’s local elections. I’m looking forward to working with you to better serve our constituents!

Today I spoke in support of our nation's dedicated diplomats -- the hard working men and women at the State Department and USAID who are heroically serving our country here and around the world. President Trump’s proposed cuts to these agencies threaten not only our leadership in the world, they put our nation's people and interests at unnecessary risk.
It's no replacement for meeting in person, but I appreciate the 3,000 constituents who listened in and asked questions on tonight's telephone town hall. Great to hear from you!

This is a step in the right direction, but we still need an independent, bipartisan commission to #FollowTheFacts on Russia's interference in our election. Protecting our democracy is not a partisan issue.
NA
Great to see Cecile Richards this week. You can count on me to stand with you against attempts to restrict women's health care. #IStandwithPP
Great to hear from the community in Wheeling this morning at our sixth Congress on Your Corner event. Meeting with you at events like these makes me a better representative. Thanks for coming!
Enjoyed the opportunity to speak and answer questions at Congregation BJBE this morning in Deerfield.
Check out our weekly newsletter for an update on legislation I introduced to prevent overprescribing of opioids, as well as invitations to two upcoming events in the Tenth District.
Best wishes to all in the Tenth District and around the world celebrating Passover this evening. From my family to yours, Chag Sameach!
Lots of great questions from the 7th graders at Caruso Middle School - District 109 this morning as we kick off a day of meetings with students and teachers across the Tenth District.

Continuing our education tour of the Tenth District today in Grayslake and Niles. Spoke about the importance of #STEM education and learned about student PLTW - Project Lead The Way projects at Tech Campus. Later this afternoon answered great student questions on small business, climate change, and the legislative process at Gemini Junior High School (East Maine School District 63).

Sean Spicer’s disturbing comments today show a blatant ignorance of the horrors of the Holocaust and deserve to be roundly condemned. This episode underscores the continuing importance that all in the United States and world fully remember the Holocaust and learn from this tragedy so as never again to allow the evil of genocide.
Wrapped up our education tour yesterday speaking with the Deerfield High School Israel Club. Incredibly thoughtful questions about current events and the complex politics of the Middle East.

In a new letter, 1,470 economists agree that fixing our broken immigration system will strengthen the American economy. Immigration reform isn’t just the right thing to do – it’s an economic necessity.

If this report is accurate, President Trump's decision not to appoint an envoy to fight anti-Semitism is both unfortunate and short-sighted. Anti-Semitism is on the rise, particularly in Europe. Filling the special envoy position, which was created under President George W. Bush, will send a strong message to the world that the United States is committed to fighting anti-Semitism, bigotry and hatred in all its forms.That's  why I joined with my colleagues in a letter urging President Trump to appoint someone to this post immediately, and why I helped introduce bipartisan legislation to elevate the envoy position to an ambassadorship.
I’ll keep repeating it: the American people deserve an independent, bipartisan commission to #FollowTheFacts
Great to hear from you Libertyville! Here are some photos from this afternoon at our seventh Congress On Your Corner.
A very happy Easter to all those celebrating today in the Tenth District and around the world!

Spent the morning with the Joint Chiefs Authority at Northeastern Illinois Public Safety Training Academy (NIPSTA). Appreciate all these first responders and public safety professionals do for our communities.
A group picture after meeting with the AdvoCats club at Libertyville High School. Great questions on the environment, immigration, and the situation in North Korea to name a few.

Scenes from the budget workshop we hosted last night at Lake Forest College in partnership with bipartisan The Concord Coalition. Participants had the opportunity to work in small groups to find fiscal solutions, and all came away with a better understanding of the federal budget challenges we face. We must consciously remember them, and the survivors, to ensure the world never forgets the evil that perpetrated such heinous crimes, and to ensure the lessons of the Shoah are passed on from generation to generation.
